item.title: The Lunatic Who Shaped English
item.description: During a recent dive into history, I had the uncanny experience of crossing paths with the remarkable Dr. William Chester Minor. At first glance, Dr. Minor seemed like a man of great stature - a skilled surgeon, a war veteran, and an avid bibliophile. But there was more to him than what met the eye - he was also a libertine, a schizophrenic, and, most infamously… a murderer. And yet, from within the walls of a mental asylum, he became one of the most vital contributors to the Oxford English Dictionary. This is the story of my encounter...

item.title: Thoughts To Text
